items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Reduce the number of pending messages allowed in an HRMP channel
items.content:
By default, when opening an HRMP channel, the number of pending messages that can be queued on the relay chain for the channel is the one defined in the active host configuration (`HostConfiguration::hrmp_channel_max_capacity`).

The current value is 1000 and this referenda proposes to reduce it to 25.

A sending parachain can push at most 1 HRMP message to the relay chain per block while the receiving parachain processes all the pending messages at once. When the limit of pending messages is reached, the sending parachain can't forward any more HRMP message to the relay chain, having to queue them locally. The local queue also has a backpressure mechanism. Even if the receiving parachain has a delay of a couple of blocks in processing the pending messages, 25 pending messages should be enough for everything to work smoothly. 

And if we're in a corner case where the receiving parachain is stalled, it's best to not have a lot of pending HRMP messages on the relay chain, since this will increase the load on the receiving parachain when it recovers.

The new limit will apply only to newly opened channels. This will not impact the channels that are already opened, which will keep the old limit. 

Also this is just the default limit and it will apply to the channels opened via `establish_channel_with_system` for example. If a bigger limit is needed for an HRMP channel, there are extrinsics that can be used for setting a custom limit.

Whitelisting referenda: https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referenda/396

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Runtime Upgrade to v1.6.2
items.content:
This is a referendum that authorises the upgrade of the Polkadot Relay Chain to version 1.6.2. This version includes an urgent [relay chain fix](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/pull/9564) for the bug that has caused the [Kusama stall](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/issues/9546). 

If approved, the authorisation will be enacted at block [#27705996](https://polkadot.subscan.io/block/27705996), estimated time: 2025-09-10 08:45:39 (UTC).

For the full list of changes, please read the fellowship [1.6.2 ](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.6.2) release notes.

It is important that this runtime upgrade is enacted before [#1721 ](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/1721) which enables RFC103. For that reason I temporarily removed the [#1721 ](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/1721) pre-image. 

Whitelist: https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referenda/394

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Enable RFC103
items.content:
**PLEASE NOTE:**

A new proposal ([#1736](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/1736)) for upgrading Polkadot’s relay chain to the [1.6.2](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.6.2) release is now up for vote. Before this referendum (including RFC103) is approved, the [1.6.2 ](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.6.2) upgrade must be executed onchain. The upgrade includes the [relay chain fix](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/pull/9564) for the bug that has caused the [Kusama stall](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/issues/9546), solving a potential issue on Polkadot as well. 

Please note that [#1736 ](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/1736) should be executed before this proposal passes. Therefore the submitter has deleted the preimage for this proposal for now.

--------

This referendum enables the RFC103 feature in the relay chain runtime and if approved it will be enacted on 8th of Sep (Monday around 8:00 UTC) at block [#27677196 ](https://polkadot.subscan.io/block/27677196)

Once enacted, the relay chain  Elastic Scaling feature is complete and live!  RFC103 is a `PoV` replay protection mechanism that is mandatory to be implemented by parachains that will use multiple cores. 

We have successfully enabled RFC103 on Kusama with [569](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/569). More details can be found in [this](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/elastic-scaling-wen-500ms-blocks/11971/4?u=sandreim) forum post.

Whitelist: https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referenda/390

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Upgrade remaining system chains to 1.6.x and fix XCM version subscriptions
items.content:
This proposal aims to upgrade remaining system chains to [v1.6.1](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.6.1), except for Asset Hub which was not changed in v1.6.1, and so will be upgraded to [v1.6.0](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.6.0).

In addition this proposal also includes a call to [Fix XCM version subscriptions for some system chains](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/issues/795)

These are being bundled into one proposal to avoid back-to-back whitelisted referenda. The Fellowship is also voting in parallel to whitelist the proposal hash. If approved, it is scheduled to enact at block [27476030](https://polkadot.subscan.io/block/27476030).

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Runtime Upgrade to v1.6.1
items.content:
This is a referendum is part of the upgrade path to enable Elastic Scaling. It contains the polkadot-sdk `2503-7` update which adds support for slashing/disabling validators that that dispute valid candidates and validator re-enabling. This is expected to significantly improve how the system handles dispute spam and allows us to enable RFC103 without causing finality issues we have seen on our [first attempt](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/2025-05-09-kusama-dispute-storm-postmortem/12947) . 

For the full list of changes, please read the fellowship [1.6.0](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.6.0) and  [1.6.1](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.6.1) release notes.

Enactment is set at block [26902523](https://polkadot.subscan.io/block/26902523) estimated time: 2025-07-16 08:07:45 (UTC)

Whitelist: https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referenda/368

items.title: Upgrade Coretime system chain to 1.6.0 and 100 cores
items.content:
## Description

There are two changes proposed here:
1. A runtime upgrade of Coretime system chain to 1.6.0.
2. Increasing the number of cores from 66 to 100.

The runtime upgrade is meant to fix the current Coretime [situation](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/april-2025-coretime-purchase/12526) on Polkadot. It does this by the following:

1. We configure a minimum price of 10 DOT, to prevent prices to drop to unreasonable low values, which cause the system to take forever to recover in case demand picks up.
2. Renewals are now no longer completely decoupled from the market, but will be adjusted to cost at least the end price of the current sale. Immediate effect will be that renewals will be adjusted to the minimum price too.

Details are outlined in https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/RFCs/pull/149.

Some fellowship members had a call with all parachain teams describing changes of RFC-149 in detail and from what I know they were on board and want the coretime issue get fixed.

The enactment block of the proposal was chosen to be https://polkadot.subscan.io/block/26803000.
Note however, that both changes will take place in the next sale period after the enactment, which is around July 25/26.

## Build

```
opengov-cli build-upgrade --network polkadot --only --coretime "1.6.0"
# modify the build call to 0x630004000100b50f04082f0000060202eb4353e21a0600a428020800095b5a86cc8055e729b7b8660f2f551d8bfe6712b24d2e637a0624444addcc8d2e32128c00
opengov-cli submit-referendum \
    --proposal "0x630004000100b50f04082f0000060202eb4353e21a0600a428020800095b5a86cc8055e729b7b8660f2f551d8bfe6712b24d2e637a0624444addcc8d2e32128c00" \
    --network "polkadot" --track whitelistedcaller --at 26803000
```

items.content:
The dev team was informed of a security issue affecting Polkadot-sdk. More information will come after the fix. This runtime upgrade aims to fix the issue, changes can be found on the release. Please note the upgrade is submitted on Whitelisted Caller track, meaning the Fellowship is voting on a parallel submission to whitelist this proposal hash.

Please review and vote at your convenience!

items.content:

We are canceling this upgrade after the Kusama incident. We will prepare a new version that includes the following improvements in dispute handling:

- validator re-enabling

After this runtime upgrade is enacted, another referenda for enabling RFC103 on the Polkadot relay chain is required for Elastic Scaling to be live.

items.title: Assigning Coretime to Xcavate and Mythical
items.content:
Both Mythical and Xcavate currently own bulk Coretime. However, both have missed the opportunity to renew their core. The problem is that someone bought all the cores because they [think that the current price per core is too low](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/april-2025-coretime-purchase/12526). While the assessment is correct that the price per core is too low and tries to draw more attention to the topic, this should not be done at the expense of existing parachains. Without Coretime, parachains will not be able to produce blocks. I contacted the Coretime buyer via mail and asked to buy two cores for 200 DOT per core. The Coretime buyer requested $150K USD for one core. This demonstrates that the Coretime buyer is ultimately just a scammer who is not genuinely interested in improving the Coretime system. As I and others want to ensure that Mythical and Xcavate are able to produce blocks, I'm opening this whitelisting proposal. As a member of the Fellowship, I acknowledge the scamming attempt as a flaw in the Coretime protocol. I also opened an [issue](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/RFCs/issues/142) to discuss potential improvements to the protocol, ensuring that reasonable projects always get access to Coretime and are protected from scammers. I and other members of the Fellowship will push for a fast change to ensure this kind of scamming does not occur again in the future. We also don't want to repeat this kind of proposal. It should be a one-off proposal to help these two parachains. For the future, we encourage every parachain to opt-in to the auto-renew feature of the Coretime chain. A proper guide for setting up this feature will soon be added to the Polkadot wiki.

The proposal will send two XCM messages to the Coretime chain. Each XCM message will request the relay chain to increase the core count from `62` to `66` cores. So, in total, `4` new cores will be added to the relay chain offering. The tasks `3369` (Mythical) and `3,413` (Xcavate) will both be assigned a lease for `~64` days. So, they will get around `~2` months of free Coretime. The last operation of each XCM message is to call `set_storage`. This `set_storage` call puts each parachain into the so-called `WorkPlan` for the next region. This ensures that both parachains will receive a core assignment in the next region.

items.title: Set Snowbridge-wrapped USDC & USDT as sufficient assets, set their ED to $0.01, and set their metadata on Asset Hub
items.content:
This is a redo of proposal [1510](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/1510). There was an oversight on my side on the call. It was using a double wrapped `DispatchWhitelistedCallWithPreImage` call and that was wrong. The outer call was whitelisted by the fellowship, but not the inner call. Thus, the execution on chain failed.

This proposal is exactly the same as the old one, but without the "double wrap".

items.title: Set Snowbridge-wrapped USDC & USDT as sufficient assets, set their ED to $0.01, and set their metadata on Asset Hub
items.content:
Thanks to Basti for helping us with the Whitelisting part of this <3

See discussion: https://polkadot.subsquare.io/posts/408

# Summary

This referendum proposes the following changes:
## Snowbridge-wrapped USDC:

- Set as [sufficient asset](https://wiki.polkadot.network/general/web3-and-polkadot/#sufficient-assets)

- Set [existential deposit](https://support.polkadot.network/support/solutions/articles/65000168651-what-is-the-existential-deposit-) to $0.01 (MinBalance: 10 000)
- Set metadata:
  - Name: USDC (Snowbridge)
  - Symbol: USDC
  - Decimals: 6 (it is currently 6, this just adds that to the metadata)

## Snowbridge-wrapped USDT:
- Set as [sufficient asset](https://wiki.polkadot.network/general/web3-and-polkadot/#sufficient-assets)
- Set [existential deposit](https://support.polkadot.network/support/solutions/articles/65000168651-what-is-the-existential-deposit-) to $0.01 (MinBalance: 10 000)
- Set metadata:
  - Name: Tether USD (Snowbridge)
  - Symbol: USDT
  - Decimals: 6 (it is currently 6, this just adds that to the metadata)

It is worth mentioning that we believe a lot of the Polkadot DAO think the only sufficient assets on Polkadot Asset Hub are DOT, USDC (Native), and USDT (Native), but there are some additional ones, including:
- [ETH](https://ibb.co/zVgQGbV3) (Snowbridge)
- [WETH](https://ibb.co/WpWCYGRz) (Snowbridge)
- [KSM](https://ibb.co/ZZkmD26) (P<>K Bridge)

This referendum basically adds to that list, we believe that it is beneficial to make obviously valuable (ETH/WETH for example) or stable assets (stables from Ethereum) sufficient. It is also entirely possible to remove sufficiency from an asset in the future.

View the full context:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/e/2PACX-1vRbLwGg2PW-uxyO4PLNrm350HDteBMTc7X3_vy_hYkJdLu2BJSnohh83nJiQvU3rRTGpD0xNqRX9EWG/pub

Cheers,

[Leemo](https://x.com/LeemoXD), [N4DRO](https://x.com/N4DRO), [lolmcshizz](https://x.com/lolmcshizz) and [Crane](https://x.com/0xCrane)

items.title: Set PoV size limit to 10 Mb
items.content: Following the successful enablement of 10 Mb PoVs on Kusama, we're now ready to enable it on Polkadot as well. It will allow parachains to make better use of blockspace, building larger blocks and using more space for proofs, which is especially important for parachains with large states.

items.title: Upgrade Snowbridge Gateway Contract
items.content:
This proposal aims to upgrade the Snowbridge [Gateway](https://etherscan.io/address/0x27ca963c279c93801941e1eb8799c23f407d68e7) contract on Ethereum, which is remotely governed by OpenGov utilizing Snowbridge itself as a cross-chain governance bridge.

# New Features

The upgraded gateway supports new user-facing features:

-   Bridging Polkadot-native assets such as DOT to Ethereum
-   Bridging native Ether from Ethereum to Polkadot without using the WETH ERC20 contract as a wrapper.

# Technical Details

This proposal will update the Gateway proxy at [0x27ca963c279c93801941e1eb8799c23f407d68e7](https://etherscan.io/address/0x27ca963c279c93801941e1eb8799c23f407d68e7) with a new implementation contract at [0x4a4559CCD9195C3CABBd4Da00854A434E8dd2Ea3](https://etherscan.io/address/0x4a4559CCD9195C3CABBd4Da00854A434E8dd2Ea3).

This contract was built and deployed using:

-   Repository: [https://github.com/Snowfork/snowbridge](https://github.com/Snowfork/snowbridge)
-   Commit: 2bc718fb07786e47c945b4ecec4ddc6ed4c0eaeb
-   Command: `cd contracts; scripts/deploy.sh scripts/upgrades/polkadot/DeployGateway202502.sol`

# Testing

The upgrade proposal was extensively tested using simulations on forked instances of both Polkadot and Ethereum mainnet. This was done using Chopsticks and Foundry for Polkadot and Ethereum respectively.

Since the Ethereum side of snowbridge has no fallback governance or centralized escape hatches, it is critical to ensure that the upgrade does not affect the ongoing viability the gateway. In this regard, the fork tests in [ForkUpgrade202502.t.sol](https://github.com/Snowfork/snowbridge/blob/main/contracts/test/ForkUpgrade202502.t.sol) verify that cross-chain signalling is preserved.

# Audits

The Ethereum contracts were audited at revision `cb05e1f8bf7018dfca42a8d93d73826a97c99100`, which includes the features described above. The audit report is still undergoing a QA process and will only be published some time later. We can provide a provisional audit report on request.

items.title: Plan B: Rebond 200k DOT for Parallel Fi
items.content:
**Context**

Following the execution of Referenda 1339, the attacker maliciously added their key as a proxy to the newly established sudo key, effectively freezing all associated PARA funds under the account. As a consequence, the new sudo key is unable to send transactions while the attacker retains sudo ownership. Additionally, the attacker has initiated unbonding on all six of our accounts, putting 200,000 DOT at risk. With only 8 days remaining to act, it is crucial to pass this referendum as soon as possible.

To address this issue, Referenda 1424 has been submitted. However, given the time remaining until unstaking concludes, we plan to execute a straightforward rebond call to restake the DOT. This will provide an additional 28 days for Referenda 1424 to be executed.

**The addresses designated for rebonding DOT are:**

14quGMw2tot6JxY2wSyk1Vc1uns3EmMRs2eQS2C66Mdv6uE9 19cnUyebu52RUt4Rt67brDmmnVdaDD37xdxKbaJ7tuLnLfu 16kTs7tsJ6tYYWAXSWDmm4vYnRTFPWEhXTk4rNCtbw6NRvte 16ZbwPMyrp9yTbPScDqm9btzcNVKKQ5MHcMQp4rA1ztF4sBA 1dMif8G4jrXsdPSkvF87uBfaiahh2EvC9fPnsi91v4i1xKC

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Update schedulerParams.lookahead configuration parameter to 3
items.content:
This referenda increases schedulerParams.lookahead value to 3.
Why this change is needed?

scheduler.lookahead determines the size of the claim queue and at the moment is set to 2. The claim queue shows which parachains are about to be scheduled on a specific core. A value of two shows what will be scheduled for a window of two blocks.

asyncBackingParams.allowedAncestryLen is an async backing parameter which determines the oldest relay parent a candidate can be built on. 2 here means that a candidate can be built on the latest know relay parent or the two relay parents before it. In total this gives a window of three blocks.

So we have got a discrepancy. Async backing will accept candidates based on three different blocks while the claim queue shows information only about two. Bumping schedulerParams.lookahead to 3 will correctly align these values.

The same change was executed on Kusama: https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/488

Link to the whitelisting referenda on Collectives: https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referenda/288

Of special note is adding all assets in pool with native xcm payment on Asset Hub and improving bridges usage adding support for Ether on Snowbridge, among other things.

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Increasing nDelayTranches from 89 to 213
items.content:
Whitelisted by fellowship: https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referenda/285

Update the setNDelayTranches from 89 to 213, which will reduce the number of assignments per candidate per delay tranche from ~5.61 to ~2.33, the justification why this is the desired value for this parameter can be found in ELVES https://eprint.iacr.org/2024/961 paper and here https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/issues/6853#issuecomment-2540373492.

The high level impact is twofold, it reduces the overall load in the presence of validators that are no-shows and it reduces the impact that a few no-show validators could have on the finality lags because those no-show validators would be assigned less often.

This configuration change has been running already on kusama since https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/484 and it had the expected effects.

items.title: Wrong Track - Please vote NAY
Referendum #1322: Rebond DOT from Parallel Fi accounts - Description below
items.content:
**Goal of the Proposal:**

- To rebond all balances related to the attack.
- The approach does not impact the sovereignty of the funds but delays availability of funds
- It allows the Parallel team to win time and explore alternatives to regaining control of their parachain governance. 

**Context:**

An account took control over Parallel Fi governance, upgraded the parachain's runtime and used it to transfer out over DOT and USDT. The account executed a malicious runtime upgrade, introducing a custom "sudo" pallet, granting themselves administrative privileges on the parachain. Through the proxy account, they successfully transferred DOT from three of the parachain’s DOT staking ledger accounts to their account. To obfuscate the trail, the account moved assets across parachains: including from AssetHub USDT to Moonbeam (most channels between parachains have been closed by now). The account is still actively unstaking staked DOT through an added proxy.

To fix this a root proposal is needed: however given the time calculated until unstaking ends, might make a root proposal unsuccessful. This whitelisted proposal aims to issue a simple rebond call to restake the DOT to buy additional 28 days of time for Parallel: providing time for the team to look into options to regain control of its parachain governance. The addresses in which DOT is to be rebonded are:

`14quGMw2tot6JxY2wSyk1Vc1uns3EmMRs2eQS2C66Mdv6uE9` (22.649 DOT) `19cnUyebu52RUt4Rt67brDmmnVdaDD37xdxKbaJ7tuLnLfu` (74.614 DOT) `16kTs7tsJ6tYYWAXSWDmm4vYnRTFPWEhXTk4rNCtbw6NRvte` (1.566 DOT) `16ZbwPMyrp9yTbPScDqm9btzcNVKKQ5MHcMQp4rA1ztF4sBA` (101.322 DOT) `1dMif8G4jrXsdPSkvF87uBfaiahh2EvC9fPnsi91v4i1xKC` (3.413 DOT)

These addresses hold Parallel Fi funds.

Call data: [here](https://polkadot.js.org/apps/?rpc=wss%3A%2F%2Fpolkadot-rpc.dwellir.com#/extrinsics/decode/0x1500160d02d721ec7d460998cc42686dbb0f57ea9d59f1e2380eaf371fd1fadb72ef3d817ce8000000010a000000).

Preimage hash: [here](https://polkadot.js.org/apps/?rpc=wss%3A%2F%2Fpolkadot-rpc.dwellir.com#).

This proposal, given its root need, has been submitted via Whitelisted Caller Track. A proposal to whitelist the submission is up for vote on Technical Fellowship as well. Please note that relay chain is **not** affected by this event but we aim to assist the Parallel parachain community in taking back control of these accounts. 

Please make sure to review and vote at your convenience!

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Upgrade Polkadot Relay and Asset Hub to v1.3.4, setting Polkadot inflation to 120M DOT per year
items.content:
This referendum upgrades the Polkadot Relay and Polkadot Asset Hub to Fellowship release [v1.3.4](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.3.4).
This upgrade changes Polkadot inflation to 120M DOT per year in line with the outcome of Ref [1139](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/1139).
Full details of the upgrade can be found at the [release page](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.3.4)

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Upgrade Polkadot to v1.3.3
items.content:
This referendum upgrades the Polkadot Relay and all System Parachains to Fellowship release v1.3.3. The full changelog can be found on the [v1.3.3 release page](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.3.3).

Key additions include:
- The capabilities for making the current inflation formula adjustable - this does not change anything yet, but allows the inflation formula to be adjusted by governance
- Fix an issue from the initial Coretime migration, where the end timeslices of leases were incorrect
- Restore corrupted staking ledgers
- Allow signed origins to send arbitrary XCMs from the Relay Chain, Asset Hub and the People Chain
- Allow Polkadot, Kusama and Ethereum assets across P<>K bridge

Due to the time sensitive nature of the coretime migration, this should pass within the next 12 days and thus the enactment time is set for [this block](https://polkadot.subscan.io/block/22974774) around 8am UTC on 15th October.

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Increase validator set size to 500
items.content:
Whitelisted by: https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referenda/220?tab=call

This call increases the current validator set size from 400 to 500, this a followup of https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/1129, that increased the validator set size from 297 to 400.

Following this change the maximum number of usable cores supported by polkadot will increase from 80(400 / 5) to 100 (500 / 5) where 5 is the dimension of a parachain backing group.

Additionally, this reverts back the maximum number of validator candidates to 2000, that was modified in https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/1129, because it is not needed until we decide to increase the validator set size to 1000. 

## Testing

Kusama has been running with 500 parachain consensus validators for 3 months since this referenda passed: https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/416

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Fix incorrect price for first coretime sale
items.content:
In referendum 1161, the Coretime Chain was configured and the sales started. Unfortunately the wrong units were used in the call to start the sales. This means that the sale base price is 1 nanoDOT, instead of 10 DOT.

This referendum simply sets the state for the `sale_info` to change both the `end_price` and `sellout_price` from 10 to 100,000,000,000 via an XCM Transact. By this referendum passing before the interlude ends, the current sale will be unaffected.

This is a high priority which must pass within 6.5 days to ensure the 5 cores on the open market are not sold at this unintended low price. Therefore tidying up the other incorrect values in state is put off to another referendum.

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Configure the Coretime Chain and start sales
items.content:
This referendum configures the broker and collator selection pallets on the Coretime Chain. It is a follow up to 
[1143](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/1143) and [1107](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/1107) and is the last step in the transition of the Polkadot network to Agile Coretime.

It is set to enact at block [22602000](https://polkadot.subscan.io/block/22602000) at the earliest, which falls just after 0900 UTC on 2024-09-19. This is to ensure that it will pass after 1143 even if this is highly backed.

More information about the calls:
The desired candidates and candidacy bond are set to 7 and 1000 DOT respectively to bring them in line with other Polkadot System Parachains.
 
The broker pallet is configured using the following config:
```
{
  advanceNotice: 10
  interludeLength: 50,400
  leadinLength: 100,800
  regionLength: 5,040
  idealBulkProportion: 100.00%
  limitCoresOffered: null
  renewalBump: 3.00%
  contributionTimeout: 5,040
}
```
which is very similar to the configuration on the Kusama Coretime Chain, but with a longer lead-in period (and thus shorter fixed-price period at the end of the sale).

The sales are started with 5 cores on the open market and a target price of 10 DOT. This means that the price at the start of the lead-in period will be 100 DOT, decreasing according to the pricing curve through the lead-in period. This also means that leases ending in this period will be allowed to renew at 100 DOT.

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Upgrade Polkadot to v1.3.x (transition to Agile Coretime)
items.content:
This referendum upgrades the Polkadot Relay, Asset Hub, Bridge Hub and People Chain to v1.3.0. The Collectives chain is upgraded directly to 1.3.1 to fix an issue with transaction payments. Find out more in the release notes of [v1.3.0](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.3.0) and [v1.3.1](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.3.1)

With the Polkadot Relay chain's upgrade, we also migrate the system to Agile Coretime. The Coretime Chain was registered in referendum 1107. This referendum is step two of three of the migration to Agile Coretime and does not start the sales on the Coretime Chain, this will happen in the third referendum.

items.title: Snowbridge: Update Bridge Pricing Parameters to Lower Transfer Fees
items.content:
When Snowbridge was launched the transfer fees were calculated based on the following parameters which reflected market conditions at the time:

-   Worst Case Gas price: `60 Gwei`
-   `ETH:DOT` exchange rate: `1:450`

This resulted in price in the following prices: 

-   `11.456568 DOT` to transfer from Polkadot to Ethereum.
-   `0.000399 ETH` to transfer from Ethereum to Polkadot.

This proposal will change the pricing parameters to:

-   Worst Case Gas price: `25 Gwei`
-   `ETH:DOT` exchange rate: `1:566`

Resulting in the following fees:

-   `6.1278015332 DOT` to transfer from Polkadot to Ethereum.
-   `0.000317 ETH` to transfer from Ethereum to Polkadot.

Old Pricing Params:

```
setPricingParameters({
    exchangeRate: 2,222,222,222,222,222
    rewards: {
        local: 100,000,000
        remote: 250,000,000,000,000
    }
    feePerGas: 60,000,000,000
    multiplier: 1,333,333,333,333,333,333
})
```

New Pricing Params:

```
setPricingParameters({
    exchangeRate: 1,766,784,452,296,820
    rewards: {
        local: 100,000,000
        remote: 250,000,000,000,000
    }
    feePerGas: 25,000,000,000
    multiplier: 1,333,333,333,333,333,333
})
```

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Register the Polkadot Coretime Chain
items.content:
This call registers and onboards the Polkadot Coretime Chain based on the [v1.3.0](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.3.0) release. Instructions to reproduce the chain-spec and genesis data are included in the release. A chain-spec is included there for node operators, and will also be added to the polkadot-sdk repository with the other system chain-specs.

This does not initiate the migration to Agile Coretime, but is a prerequisite before the migration can be run. A follow-up referendum will update the Polkadot Relay Chain and migrate existing leases to the Coretime Chain, then a third referendum will configure the Coretime Chain and start the sales.

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Enable Elastic Scaling MVP node feature
items.content:
The call enables a node feature required by Elastic Scaling MVP. Once enabled, block authors will start providing the core index of parachain candidates to the runtime. 

The referenda is required to be executed before core time arrives on Polkadot. Core time will allow parachains to have more than one core assigned at a given relay chain block. Parachains that have more than one core assigned cannot make progress without the core index information provided to the runtime.

Whitelisted by https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referenda/173

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Upgrade BridgeHub: v1.2.8
items.content:
The upgrade only affects BridgeHub. The upgrade contains a change to the Snowbridge Ethereum client to be much more cost efficient, resulting in a lower cost to run the bridge (estimated decrease from around $17,000 to $1,700 per month, which lowers the pressure on Treasury to run the bridge).

Release notes: https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.2.8
Enactment is set for [5 August](https://polkadot.subscan.io/block/21958000).

items.title: People Chain Migration and Release
items.content:
This is a runtime upgrade specific to the launch of the People Chain and takes place in two steps:

1. Immediate upgrade authorization of the Relay Chain to v1.2.7. This allows anyone to call the `reap_identity` function, which will remove the identity from the subs and reserve the new amount on the People Chain.
2. Scheduled upgrade of the People Chain 3 days (43,200 blocks) later that unblocks calls to allow public use. This will give a three day window to migrate all identities.

Release notes are in [v1.2.7](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.2.7) from the Fellowship.

This is steps 2 and 3 of the plan [outlined here](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/people-chain-launch-and-identity-migration-plan/5930).

Enactment is set for [25 July](https://polkadot.subscan.io/block/21800000).

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Update HRMP Channel Limits
items.content: [Ref 896](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/896) failed because the pallet has a [hardcoded limit](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/blob/d2fd536/polkadot/runtime/parachains/src/hrmp.rs#L48). This updates the config to the limit value instead.

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Register Polkadot People Chain
items.content:
This call registers and onboards the Polkadot People Chain with all the Identity info taken from the existing state of the Relay Chain. The runtime is based on [v1.2.6](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.2.6). The release notes include instructions on how to generate the genesis state and also contain a chain spec for node operators.

Note for wallets and UIs: Once the People Chain is onboarded, UIs should fetch Identity info from the chain and stop using the Relay Chain. Deposits will be migrated with the enactment of [983](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/983).

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Update Max HRMP Channels
items.content: Updates the maximum number of inbound and outbound HRMP channels per parachain to 150 in each direction.

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Make WETH asset sufficient and set asset metadata
items.content:
Since Snowbridge has launched and the ERC-20 Wrapped Ether token ([WETH](https://etherscan.io/token/0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2)) has [been registered on AssetHub](https://assethub-polkadot.subscan.io/foreign_assets/f1846f14a52715c2a09df52ef8f077c52977dcfd?tab=holders), set WETH to be a sufficient asset (allow the WETH account to exist without requiring an existential deposit in DOT or another sufficient asset). This ensures a better UX for new users who may not have a DOT balance on AssetHub, even though the Snowbridge UI will warn the user before attempting a transfer without the required existential deposit of a sufficient asset.

Additionally, this referendum sets WETH's metadata to match the metadata on Ethereum:

`{ name: 'Wrapped Ether', symbol: 'WETH', decimals: 18 }`

items.title: Enable approval voting protocol improvements
items.content:
This referendum enables two approval voting protocol improvements that are a prerequisite to **scale up the number of Polkadot validators to 500**.  

Once enacted, the validators will start using the new format for approval voting assignments and also approve multiple candidates under a single signature. The impact is the reduction of network bandwidth and CPU usage of the approval voting protocol.

High level tracking issue for scaling the validator set: https://github.com/paritytech/roadmap/issues/26

Relevant node side changes (released Q4 2023): 
- v2 assignment certificates : https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/pull/1178
- approval of multiple candidates with single signature: https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/pull/1191

Whitelisted by https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referenda/130

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Upgrade Polkadot: v1.2.6
items.content:
This is a partial upgrade as only the Relay Chain and Asset Hub are affected. This release locks the Identity pallet and will enable migration to the People Chain.

Note to all wallets/UIs: Identity will be unusable until the launch of the People Chain and migration of info there. UIs should also prepare to read Identity information from the People Chain once it launches. Total expected downtime is 2-3 weeks.

Release notes: https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.2.6

Enactment is set for [8 July](https://polkadot.subscan.io/block/21558000).

Here's a table that should help UIs know what to do:

| Polkadot Relay Version | Polkadot People Chain Version | What it means                                                                                                                                                 |
| ------------- | -------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| v1.2.5        | N/A                  | Accounts can no longer `request_judgement`. Registrars should address all outstanding requests.                                                               |
| v1.2.6        | v1.2.6               | Identity is fully locked on the Relay Chain. The state still exists, but users cannot update/create/judge/etc. The info is used for the People Chain genesis. |
| v1.2.7        | v1.2.6               | Identities are being "reaped" on the Relay Chain and deposits freed. All UIs should start fetching Identity from the People Chain.                            |
| v1.2.7        | v1.2.7               | Migration is complete and People Chain has full functionality restored (at about 100x deposit reduction).                                                     |

items.title: Upgrade Polkadot v1.2.5
items.content:
This is a referendum to upgrade Polkadot to v1.2.5. See the [Fellowship release notes](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.2.5) for more details.

Of special note is the inclusion of the new `CheckMetadataHash` extension. This is a breaking change for transaction encoding on all chains. Please update wallets and applications accordingly.

Enactment is set for block [21,455,000](https://polkadot.subscan.io/block/21455000), which should land on 1 July.

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Upgrade Polkadot v1.2.4
items.content:
This upgrades Polkadot to v1.2.4: https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.2.4

Enactment is set for [Tuesday, 11 June](https://polkadot.subscan.io/block/21169000).

items.title: Move Part of Treasury to Asset Hub
items.content:
This proposal does two things:

1. It moves 5 million DOT to Asset Hub into the Treasury's account. This is a simple move from Relay to Asset Hub. This move was tested with the KSM Treasury in [Kusama 370](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/370). This will enable new spend patterns like staged payouts, as demonstrated in [Kusama 382](https://kusama.polkassembly.io/referenda/382).
2. It sets asset rates the same as [Polkadot 645](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/645), but under XCM v4. Normally, these should have been migrated with the switch to v4, but since the referendum was open when the upgrade happened, there was nothing (yet) to migrate.

Requires whitelisting from the Fellowship.

items.title: Polkadot Bridge Hub 1.2.2 upgrade: Unstuck bridge with Kusama
items.content:
This proposal was already voted as part of [https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/694](<694>) . Proposing it again since #694 failed because of a wrong weight. Failure details: [https://bridgehub-polkadot.subscan.io/block/2503902?tab=event&event=2503902-0](<https://bridgehub-polkadot.subscan.io/block/2503902?tab=event&event=2503902-0>)

This new referendum was tested end-to-end in chopsticks and it worked.

Pasting the relevant parts of the #694 description below:

The `pallet_bridge_grandpa` at Polkadot Bridge Hub is now in an inconsistent state, the Polkadot-GRANDPA-light-client running BH doesn’t correctly handle a corner case involving validator set changes following validator slashing. As a result of the bug, the GRANDPA light-client can fail to recognize the other side's validator set change and thus start refusing to accept subsequent validator set changes as well. More details can be found on this forum post.

We have encountered this bug on the BH, resulting in Kusama->Polkadot traffic being stuck. This upgrade fixes the bug so that it is protected from encountering the same issue.

Also, be aware that this proposal is submitted on the Whitelisted Caller track - a parallel submission is up for a vote on Fellowship to whitelist this proposal: [https://collectives.polkassembly.io/referenda/110](<https://collectives.polkassembly.io/referenda/110>)

This new referendum was tested end-to-end in chopsticks and it worked.

Pasting the relevant parts of the #694 description below:

items.title: Proposal Outdated - Do Not Vote: LAOS already won Auction 68 with SF Bid
items.content:
*Edit (29th April 2024)* 

**Proposal Outdated - Do Not Vote: LAOS already won Auction 68 with SF Bid**

Since LAOS Network won parachain Auction #68 with a self-funded bid, this petition is no longer required, and will not be pursued. More info can be found at [https://laosnetwork.io/crowdloan](url). 

The original text is left below for transparency.


# Description

LAOS Network started a Crowdloan for **paraid = 3370** on 2024-04-20 [[1](https://polkadot.subscan.io/extrinsic/20427493-2)], aiming at starting to compete for Auction #68 (which started later, on 2024-04-22), and potentially lasting for the remaining auctions of the current batch. The parameters set for the Crowdloan were designed to ensure that contributions would count for the ongoing lease period at the time of creation (period **16**), covering periods **16** to **23**.

The Crowdloan already had almost 100 participants even before Auction #68 started, and at the time of writing, it had received 92,477 DOT from 321 participants.

Unfortunately, Auction #68 is not recognizing the Crowdloan contributions as bids for the Auction [[2](https://polkadot.subscan.io/auction/68)].

After testing on the LAOS Rococo testing network, the issue is fixed if the **first_period** is edited from **16** to **17**, i.e. one period larger than the period at the time the Crowdloan started. 

If this issue is not fixed, all contributions will fail to be included in all the remaining auctions of this batch (#68 to #73). Crowdloan funds will be held for all this period, and eventually returned.

If fixed within approximately 1 month from now, the contributions will make it on time for the last 3 auctions.

We sincerely apologize for the oversight, as we did not find any documentation indicating that setting the first_period equal to the current period would have this impact.
We hope that this petition fits in the spirit of being considered **safe** and **neutral**, as stated in the Whitelisted Caller track guide [[3](https://wiki.polkadot.network/docs/learn-guides-polkadot-opengov#submitting-a-referendum-on-the-whitelisted-caller-track)]. 

# Concrete Proposal

We suggest executing the call to the **edit** method of the Crowdloan, to increment the **first_period** parameter by 1, from **16** to **17**.

The rest of parameters would remain intact, in particular the **last_period**, guaranteeing that the intention of all contributors is respected, and funds are not locked, in case of winning an auction, beyond the block they initially committed to. 

The values set initially can be checked in this transaction [[1](https://polkadot.subscan.io/extrinsic/20427493-2)]:

```
paraid: 3370
cap: 5000000000000000
first_period: 16
last_period: 23
end: 21413000
```

The new values just change **first_period: 16 --> 17**. The details of the call can be found here:

https://polkadot.js.org/apps/?rpc=wss%3A%2F%2Frpc.dotters.network%2Fpolkadot#/extrinsics/decode/0x4905a9340f0080e03779c311445c22f21a0500


# Testing

This call has been tested locally with zombienet as well as the LAOS Rococo testing network.

items.title: Polkadot Bridge Hub 1.2.2 upgrade: Unstuck bridge with Kusama
items.content:
The `pallet_bridge_grandpa` at Polkadot Bridge Hub is now in an inconsistent state, the Polkadot-GRANDPA-light-client running BH doesn’t correctly handle a corner case involving validator set changes following validator slashing. As a result of the bug, the GRANDPA light-client can fail to recognise the other side's validator set change and thus start refusing to accept subsequent validator set changes as well. More details can be found [on this forum post](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/polkadot-kusama-bridge/2971/45).

We have encountered this bug on the BH, resulting in Kusama->Polkadot traffic being stuck. This upgrade fixes the bug so that it is protected from encountering the same issue.

Please note that there is a Polkadot runtime [upgrade](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/648) (to 1.2.0) already up for a vote, so the goal is to wait for that to happen before enacting a subsequent patch fix on top.

Also, be aware that this proposal is submitted on the Whitelisted Caller track - a parallel submission should be up for a vote on Fellowship to whitelist this proposal shortly.

items.title: Enable async backing on polkadot
items.content:
This referendum is meant for enabling async-backing on polkadot, more information about what is async backing and what this parameter changes will do can be found here [async backing](https://wiki.polkadot.network/docs/learn-async-backing)

All async backing logic will be enabled with polkadot runtime upgrade [1.2.0](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/648), but in sync mode, parachains can produce block only at 12s rate.

After this referendum parachains can decide to produce blocks at 6s rate, by following this guide https://wiki.polkadot.network/docs/maintain-guides-async-backing, but that is not mandatory, they will still run at 12s rate without any changes needed on their side.

Whitelisted by: https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referenda/102.

## Testing done

Async backing has been running on Rococo since December 2023 and on Westend since February 2024 with all system parachains migrated to produce blocks at 6s rate and on kusama after https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/374

Our final checklist enablement can be found here: https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/issues/3226

## Dependencies

- Async backing runtime APIs come in polkadot runtime v1.2, which will get enacted with: https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/648, this referendum needs to be enacted after that.

## Known issues

No critical issues are known at this moment, however  to make the transition smooth all validators need to be upgraded to a version higher that *v1.8*. There are still around 3-5% validators in the active set that are not upgraded, so when it is their turn to back they won't back anything, and if 3 out of 5 nodes are in the same backing group the group won't be  able to back the candidates it is assigned to. **Action** Un-upgraded validators please upgrade to something higher than 1.8 node version.

items.title: Upgrade Polkadot to Release v1.2.0
items.content: This is a referendum to upgrade Polkadot to the Fellowship's [v.1.20 release](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.2.0).

items.title: Bump parachain validation timeouts
items.content:
Counterpart to https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/371.

### Description

This proposal aims to increase the backing timeout on validators from 2s to 2.5s and approval-voting timeout from 12s to 15s respectively.

The rationale for the change can be found in https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/issues/3565. In short, this will help ensuring smoother experience for async backing parachains wishing to utilize the full 2s of execution per block.

### Checking

The details of the call can be found here: https://polkadot.js.org/apps/?rpc=wss%3A%2F%2Frpc-kusama.luckyfriday.io#/extrinsics/decode/0x332e0c01002000000600c4090000000000000601983a000000000000.

In addition to setting the timeouts, the `MaxMemoryPage` param is being set to the value it was set before, since the call overrides every param of `ExecutorParams`.

### Testing

This call has been tested locally with zombienet as well as on Rococo.

items.title: Setting onDemandBaseFee to 0.025 DOT
items.content:
Similarly to Kusama (see ref [here](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/364)), this proposal establishes the minimum fee for a single block order via the on-demand system at 0.025 DOT. The adjustment aims to strike a balance between discouraging spam and keeping experimentation economically feasible. Should this minimum fee prove overly restrictive upon the system's activation, a subsequent proposal may be submitted to reduce the base fee accordingly.

Note that the proposal has been submitted on the Whitelisted Caller track, meaning the Fellowship is also voting on [Referendum 89](https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referenda/89) to whitelist the hash

items.title: Fund system chains sovereign accounts on Polkadot BridgeHub for Polkadot<>Kusama bridge
items.content: The P<>K bridge charges user fees on originating Asset Hub, but it pays relayer rewards from AssetHubs' sovereign accounts on sibling BridgeHub parachains. These relayer rewards are a large part of the bridge's "operating costs". For initial deployment, AssetHub's sovereign accounts on BridgeHubs should be pre-funded by treasury. An initial 10100 DOT and 2030 KSM is proposed to be split among the relevant system chain sovereign accounts to provide initial bootstrap runway to the bridge. This will only be an initial seed. As the bridge operates, it should cover operation costs (relayer fees) from the user fees paid on Asset Hub, and any unspent user fees ("bridge profits") are going to the treasury anyway, so in the longer term these funds are practically paid back (plus profits). Exact system chain addresses being funded and amounts for each can be found here: https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/issues/238 Already whitelisted by https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referenda/88

history.content:
The purpose of this call is to initialize the Polkadot side of the Polkadot<>Kusama bridge.

It does the following:

Calls `forceXcmVersion` on following system parachains to set XCMv3 between:

    Polkadot AH <-> Polkadot BH

    Polkadot BH -> Kusama BH

    Polkadot AH -> Kusama AH

It then calls `bridgePolkadotGrandpa::initialize()` with the initial configuration for the Kusama on-chain light-cLient running on Polkadot Bridge Hub.

items.title: Set `safeXcmVersion` to 3 for AssetHub, Collectives and BridgeHub
items.content:
The call in this referenda updates the \`safeXcmVersion\` of Polkadot System Parachains to value 3.

Currently set version 2 is outdated and will be deprecated. Setting this to version 3 is required to support new V3 destinations/connections by default.

Note: Polkadot Relay already has this set to 3 so that's why it's not included in the call.

Needs to be whitelisted by: [https://collectives.polkassembly.io/referenda/77](https://collectives.polkassembly.io/referenda/77)

items.title: Setting setOnDemandQueueMaxSize to 500
items.content: Similar to Kusama, our approach on Polkadot involves adjusting the `setOnDemandMaxQueueSize` to 500. This change stems from an observation on Rococo, where a parachain's batch call for about 5,000 orders in a block, combined with a surplus of on-demand cores, resulted in notably slow block import times, as detailed in [the reported issue](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/issues/3051). As a temporary fix, we're limiting the total number of orders by modifying the configuration via `setOnDemandMaxQueueSize` to a smaller value, and for the initial launch, 500 is deemed a secure limit. Once a more permanent solution is implemented, the maximum number of orders can be reconsidered.

items.title: Compensate for insufficient `phragmenElection.renounce` unreserve amount
items.content:
Paraphrasing Basti from [this comment](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/issues/2507#issuecomment-1828227653):

> The runtime upgrade to Polkadot `0.8.28` had the following migration: [https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/blob/371681c298eb96b74ad04a09ca8097f19c777e68/runtime/polkadot/src/lib.rs#L968](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/blob/371681c298eb96b74ad04a09ca8097f19c777e68/runtime/polkadot/src/lib.rs#L968)
> 
> The second parameter to the `apply` function was the old `CandidacyBond`. It was passed as `1 DOT` while it was actually in the release before: [`100 DOT`](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/blob/2f84569930a4ae86a3ecd60fff3488753ab79aa6/runtime/polkadot/src/lib.rs#L489).
> 
> The result is now that some accounts only got 1 DOT unreserved, while it should have been 100 DOT.

This referenda calls `Balances::force_unreserve` for the two accounts which had incorrect amounts unreserved.

See [this issue](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/issues/2507) for more information.

items.title: Upgrade System to v1.1.2
items.content:
This is a referendum to upgrade the system to the [v1.1.2 Fellowship release](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.1.2).

It also includes updating the minimum balance of sufficient assets on Asset Hub to maintain their ratio to the existential deposit (following cancellation of [428](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/referenda/428)).

Enactment is set for block 19,551,000, which should happen on Monday 19 Feb.

items.title: Update Polkadot Asset Hub v1,001,001 and Sufficient Asset Minimum Balances
items.content:
## Note: Reject

Due to the [issue](<https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/issues/3070>) discovered on Kusama with the v1.1.0 release, recommendation is to cancel/reject this referendum until a patch release with [the fix](<https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot-sdk/pull/3075>) is applied.

---

This proposal updates Polkadot Asset Hub to the patch [release v1.1.1](<https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.1.1>), which includes the fix to reducing the existential deposit to 0.01 DOT. It also combines the call from referendum 428 (which should be rejected) to update the minimum balances of sufficient assets to maintain their ratio with the DOT existential deposit. You can check the call hashes of the inner `xcm.send(..)` to verify.

A few notes around scheduling:

- The referendum is set to enact at block 19,466,900, which is 24 hours after the v1.1.0 release upgrade is scheduled to take place. This will be Tuesday 13 Feb. This is within the 28-day decision period so is dependent on passing in time. If it passes after that block, it will just enact immediately.
- The sufficient asset minimum balance call is scheduled to enact 590 blocks *after* sending the message to authorize the Asset Hub upgrade. Since the authorization only allows one to submit the new runtime, and the upgrade takes 600 Relay Chain blocks, this will leave a minimum of 10 blocks where the ratio is different. Someone should submit the runtime in a timely manner to maintain consistency, but it should not cause major problems.

<!-- -->

items.title: Update Sufficient Asset Minimum Balances
items.content:
**Update: Recommend rejecting this proposal. I will make a new one to go with the Asset Hub upgrade that actually updates the Existential Deposit. See [this PR](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/pull/158) for more details.**

This referendum is related to the reduction of existential deposit on Asset Hubs.

When you pay fees in `sufficient` assets, the system still calculates the base transaction fee in DOT. It converts it to the asset fee amount using the ratio of minimum balances. So:

```
fee_in_dot * asset_min_balance / dot_existential_deposit
```

So, if you reduce the DOT ED by a factor of 10, you also increase fees in sufficient assets by a factor of 10 (Asset Conversion, coming soon, to avoid all this).

This proposal reduces the minimum balance requirement for all sufficient assets (USDT, USDC, and KSM) by a factor of 10, preserving the ratio. There is also a fourth call to update the metadata for bridged KSM, since that [failed when creating the asset](<122>) due to the `SafeCallFilter`.

items.title: Setting the relay chain's safeXcmVersion to v3
items.content:
The proposal addresses a recent XCM issue where the `SetTopic` instruction in XCM programs conflicts with destinations set to default version 2. This mismatch lead to failed transactions. [Referendum 305](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/305) has successfully resolved the issue on Kusama. Now, this proposal sets its sights on Polkadot's relay chain, advocating for a similar adjustment by aligning the `safeXcmVersion` to v3 and ensuring it sends XCMs in the v3 format by default.

The mismatch in XCM versions can lead to issues between the relay chain and parachains. To resolve this, we propose setting the relay chain's safeXcmVersion to v3. This adjustment ensures that the relay chain will send XCMs in the v3 format by default.

Note that the proposal has been submitted on the Whitelisted Caller track, meaning the Fellowship is also voting on a proposal (no. [56](https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referenda/56)) to whitelist the submission hash

items.title: Upgrade Polkadot v1,000,000
items.content:
This referendum updates the Polkadot Relay Chain and its Asset Hub, Collectives chain, and Bridge Hub to v1,000,000, with runtimes pulled from the [Fellowship v1.0.0 release](https://github.com/polkadot-fellows/runtimes/releases/tag/v1.0.0). See the release notes for information specific to this release.

Requires whitelist by: https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referenda/33

items.title: Tweak Polkadot's Ideal Staking Rate
items.content:
in preparation for the crowdloan unlock on October 24th, as discussed in [this forum post](https://forum.polkadot.network/t/adjusting-polkadots-ideal-staking-rate-calculation/3897), it was concluded to propose slightly increasing the ideal staking rate in Polkadot, such that the network can accommodate the new DOT that is being unlocked into the staking system, without reducing staking rewards. 

In short, what this proposal does is: 

_For the current situation, the ideal staking rate would then be calculated as: 0.75 - min(45,60)/300 = 0.6, i.e., 60%._

You can find the full steps to reproduce the proposal in [https://hackmd.io/ykunWzXYR-Kaz\_cM2KNIlg](https://hackmd.io/ykunWzXYR-Kaz_cM2KNIlg). It is merely a 1 liner change to the former Polkadot runtime that was version 9430. 

The enactment time is set to [this](https://polkadot.subscan.io/block/17840000) block, which is roughly 2 days before the funds unlock from crowdloans. 

The corresponding fellowship referendum to whitelist the call is [https://collectives.polkassembly.io/member-referenda/24](https://collectives.polkassembly.io/member-referenda/24).

items.title: Increase MaxMemoryPages to 512MB
items.content:
PVF execution currently has a memory limit of 128MB, which is the same as Cumulus uses for its block import pipeline. While collators execute state transitions by reading parachain data from disk locally, parachain validators must load state proofs into memory. Therefore, they should have a higher memory limit than collators. Otherwise, a parachain block that made full use of memory when executed by the collator could fail to be executed by validators. To fix this, we propose increasing the memory limit for PVF execution to 512MB.

Please note that a similar proposal has already been successfully executed in Kusama. As this proposal was submitted on the Whitelisted Caller track, Fellowship will be voting on a proposal to whitelist this hash.

set_config_with_executor_params {}: set_executor_params(RawOrigin::Root, ExecutorParams::from(&\[ExecutorParam::MaxMemoryPages(8192)\]\[..\]))

Call data: 0x332e040100200000

Call hash: 0x1c356149b664ec3f7d89eeb56a3469bd5f468ae7fafa2b13f2423618db6c922e

items.title: Cancel Old Auctions Schedule - Replaced by New Schedule After OpenGov Inclusion
items.content:
[Referendum 56](56) (voted and approved in Auction Track) scheduled a new set of auctions, after some issues with the existing auctions were found (the execution resulted in the failure of the auction due to BadOrigin) . The new auctions schedule executed by Ref56 is the same as the one decided before by the community: replacing the BadOrigin calls.

Referendum 56 also aimed **to cancel** the auctions resulting in BadOrigin, to clean the scheduler. However, since the proposal was up for vote and approved in auction admin track and the cancellation of these auctions needed Root origin, the cancellation was not successful. In order to complete Ref56’s plan, this proposal **aims to clean scheduler from future failed auctions, leaving only the new schedule on scheduler**.

-   Issue on GitHub: [here](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/issues/7541)
    
-   Preimage for the public referendum: [here](https://polkadot.js.org/apps/?rpc=wss%3A%2F%2Frpc.polkadot.io#/extrinsics/decode/0x0a00250117031a040801039a6e9257349bba17f88788016821455b1e3fffbd0947dcbad6e8a938b5063bac010321fc0d6cfaa46fd7ac946c6152fb989bc2ab9cbee53f389e2be0d8b68dac7765)
    
-   Public referendum to dispatch the call: [here](https://polkadot.js.org/apps/?rpc=wss%3A%2F%2Frpc.polkadot.io#/extrinsics/decode/0x1500160d02856f80bb4c18888ef355e717322ffbf4004fa80912d880ba1fd40d60835e235949000000010a000000)
    
-   Call hash: 0x6a8ce6c3c5cee277c21ae28aa2fcff8067d611bf009f050176a3cd8cee835477
    

Please note this proposal was submitted on Whitelisted Caller track: the Fellowship is also voting on a proposal to whitelist the hash for this call to execute successfully.

Make sure to vote!

items.title: Register KSM on Asset Hub
items.content:
Enacting this proposal will register the asset { parents: 2, interior: GlobalConsensus(Kusama) } on the Polkadot Asset Hub. KSM will be a sufficient asset with a minimum balance of 0.01 KSM.

The "owner" of the asset is the account ID conversion of the path (expressed as a Multilocation) to the Kusama Relay Chain, i.e. the governance location of Kusama.

This registration by governance is part of the initialization of a Polkadot <> Kusama bridge. Future assets that are sent over the bridge will not need governance motions from the system Root origin. There is a [similar referendum](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/referendum/258) to register DOT on Kusama.

A note about metadata: I discovered while testing that `force_set_metadata` is not included in the `SafeCallFilter`, so it cannot be executed over XCM. This will be fixed in [this PR](https://github.com/paritytech/cumulus/pull/3044). A follow up referendum can set the metadata (name: Kusama, symbol: KSM), however this is not necessary for functionality (and the asset identifier itself is expressive of the asset meaning).

items.title: Update Parachain Validation Config
items.content:
This referendum updates the parachain validation configuration in two ways:

1. It changes the no-show slots from 2 to 3. This change was already done [on Kusama](https://kusama.subsquare.io/referenda/referendum/232), and after review by Parity's Parachains Core team can be applied to Polkadot.
2. Removes the limit on the maximum number of parachain validators. For Polkadot, this means that all 297 validators will participate in parachain consensus.

Requires [whitelist](https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referendum/17) from the Fellowship.

items.title: Increase Parachain Validators to 250
items.content:
Following the success of raising parachain validators to 300 on Kusama, this referendum will increase parachain validators to the more conservative 250 on Polkadot. It also updates the `relay_vrf_modulo_samples`.

Whitelist via https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referendum/4

items.title: [TAKE TWO] Next revision of increasing nomination pool limits & commission
items.content:
NOTE: This was originally [#39](https://polkadot.polkassembly.io/referenda/39)

Nomination pool usage is increasing, and nomination pool commission has now rolled out on Polkadot. This referendum changes the following nomination pool settings to account for this:

- `maxPools` from 256 -> 512 (currently at 131 pools)
- `maxMembers` from 16,384 -> 49,152 (currently at >12,000 members)
- `globalMaxCommission` from 0% -> 10%, enabling pool commission on Polkadot.

Further reading:
- Polkadot Forum: https://forum.polkadot.network/t/next-revision-of-increasing-nomination-pool-limits/2498/5
- GitHub tracking issue: https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/issues/14321

items.title: Open HRMP Channels Between System Parachains
items.content: This referendum opens HRMP channels between system parachains, namely three bi-directional channels: Asset Hub <> Collectives, e.g. for Fellowship salaries; Asset Hub <> Bridge Hub, e.g. for representing bridged assets; and Collectives <> Bridge Hub, e.g. for the Fellowship acting on Kusama. Note that the first transfers to the sovereign accounts of parachains 1,001 (Collectives) and 1,002 (Bridge Hub) are slightly greater than the 20 DOT channel deposit. This is because the accounts do not exist yet and must retain at least 1 DOT (existential deposit) in free balance to succeed. Depends on the Fellowship passing https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referendum/2

items.title: [Whitelisted Caller] Referendum #18 Polkadot v9430
items.content:
This is a referendum to upgrade the Polkadot network to v9430. Release notes are available for the [Relay Chain](https://github.com/paritytech/polkadot/releases/tag/v0.9.43) and the [System Parachains](https://github.com/paritytech/cumulus/releases/tag/parachains-v9430).

Enactment is scheduled for block [16,450,000](https://polkadot.subscan.io/block/16450000), which should be mid-morning European time on Tuesday, 18 July.

Whitelist proposal: https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referendum/1

items.title: Upgrade Bridge Hub to v9420
items.content:
Sibling Fellowship Referendum: https://collectives.subsquare.io/fellowship/referendum/0

As explained in the Fellowship referendum description, the v9420 runtime upgrade did not enact successfully on the Bridge Hub because the Relay Chain's XCM version was too old. This proposal corrects the error from [Gov1 Ref 121](https://polkadot.subsquare.io/democracy/referendum/121) did for the Bridge Hub. All other calls within 121 worked as planned, only the Bridge Hub was affected.
